SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE.

No. 5

Pioneer Recreation and Social Life.

(Drawing by Richard Graburn)

Please print name and address in capital letters.

Your full name: Oliver Alexander Cowan
Present Address: Carievate
Pioneer Address: Tilsonburg
Year you came to Saskatchewan: 1892

(Throughout the questionnaire, "Saskatchewan" means the area which is now Saskatchewan)

PLEASE NOTE

This questionnaire is intended for persons who came to Saskatchewan before 1914, and most of the questions are about that early period, although in a few questions information for later years is asked for.

If you cannot answer a question, leave the space blank. We realize that any one person will not be able to answer all questions, so answer those that apply to your experience and that you can remember, and leave the others.

Use extra sheets of paper if there is not enough space on the questionnaire.

Your co-operation in answering this questionnaire will be very appreciated, and all questionnaires are preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives as part of the permanent record of our province.

Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
NEIGHBORLY VISITING, PARTIES, ETC.

1. In the first few years, how many homes were near enough to you for visiting back and forth? 15

How many of these were bachelor's homes? 6

2. How often did you usually visit neighbors? Not very many

3. Did you usually visit on a Sunday, or other days? Sunday

4. Were you often invited to other homes, or was most visiting done without an invitation? Not much done

What time of the day did you go, in the morning and spend the day, or in the afternoon, etc.? Different time

What about meals? Did you stay when not invited beforehand? No

How was the invitation to a meal worded when people had come unexpectedly? (that is, was the term to "take potluck" used, or was some other expression common?) Potluck

If no meal, what other refreshment might be offered to visitors who had "dropped in"?

5. Did the whole family go, or did someone stay home to "look after the place"? No

6. Did you ever have "bees" when groups of neighbors came together to put up a building, make quilts, or other such activity? The only bee that I can remember was when my parents' barn was being built around 1920.

Tell what you remember about such gatherings, giving dates if possible, telling what the "bees" were for, and how often they occurred.

7. In the earliest years that you were here, were there many parties, whist drives or dances in homes? Describe. Yes in house

Were these more frequent in later years? Give dates. When most got settled in their own house.

Did you follow any kind of informal schedule, such as going by turn from one home to another at definite times; every two weeks, once a week, once a month, etc.?
